meanings.definition: Make legally null and void; invalidate.
meanings.sent1: The judge nullified the contract, making it invalid.
meanings.sent2: The new evidence nullified the previous ruling.
meanings.sent3: The magician nullified the spell, causing the audience to gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her apology nullified the tension in the room, like a soothing balm.
meanings.sent5: The storm nullified all our plans, leaving us stranded indoors.

meanings.definition: Counteract the effect of; make ineffective.
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food can nullify the negative effects of junk food.
meanings.sent2: The medicine nullified the pain in her knee.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella nullified the raindrops, keeping her dry and happy.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking nullified the impact of the mistake, saving the project.
meanings.sent5: The sunscreen nullified the harmful rays of the sun, protecting her skin.
